Params[3]: The agent named Luna curls up in a dark dream—or maybe it is not a dream but the boundary of her vague M.I.N.D.
She can only hear her own voice. All the noises from the Ascension-Network are no longer to be heard.
I'm still alive... My consciousness is still here.
Luna does not understand why she is still in the form of an agent after being denied by the Ascension-Network. She was supposed to turn into a normal, mindless Corrupted.
But the Ascension-Network seems to have halted the execution—or, in a more humanly description, it's as if the Ascension-Network is thinking about something.
Luna does not want to think of the reason. Everything no longer matters to her. No one is going to step into this silent world of hers again like that rude person.
Lucia...
Knowing she is but an illusion, Luna still reaches out to the sister in her memories.
Luna is not trying to seek help or letting out her anger—she only wants to touch her sister once again to feel the warmth.
Her mouth keeps moving as if she wants to tell Luna something, but the darkness seems to have devoured her voice. Luna cannot hear anything.
Lucia seems very anxious. Luna looks at her lips, trying to read what she is saying.
Lu... Luna...
Wake... up...
Luna... Wake up!
The dark dream disappears like falling tides among Lucia's anxious cry. Her silhouette begins to twist and fade.
An invisible force is dragging Luna away from her sister. She reaches out and tries to get a little closer, but her efforts are all futile.

She has no more reason to live in the sober world. She feels like she is standing at a crossroads; the road behind her has all disappeared, but nobody tells her where to go. Only here she can feel the slightest warmth.
Why... Why don't you just let me die in that dream? It's not too bad to die here... I guess.
Luna's dream is on the brink of collapse. She closes her eyes again, knowing that she will have to face the never-ending, pale reality when she wakes up.
But unlike the countless awakenings in the past, she is greeted by a sharp agony and loud siren instead of silence and the smell of dust.
Ugh...!
Luna opens her eyes in an excruciating pain. She finds herself still in the familiar Construct lab, but everything around her is a mess. Something must have happened.
She barely twists her wrist in the restraint, then realizes there is crimson Punishing Virus coming out of her body and dissipating in the air.
This is the Omega Weapon those humans talked about...
The massive Omega Weapon behind her is emitting a crimson light. The color is not from the weapon itself, but comes from the Punishing Virus that it keeps draining from her.
The Punishing Virus outfit that forms Luna's combat suit has completely vanished. The Punishing Virus in her body will be the next.

Losing the power of agent has not impacted her frame's performance, and there is still a large amount of Punishing Virus present in Luna's body. Still, it is no match for the Omega Weapon's infinite power.
Am I... going to die like this...?
Luna has never been so close to death after she became an agent, not even when she was devoured by the Polyphage. This is the most powerful weapon humans have created for Ascendants.
Maybe this isn't too bad after all... As the enemies of humans, Ascendants are destined to kill them, or be killed by them.

She suddenly hears a lot of noises outside, followed by a loud bang. A slender Construct knocks the Construct lab door open and rushes in, along with a Corrupted that has been crushed to pieces long ago.
You...
Karenina jumps up and shakes the dust off like a rabbit. She gracefully turns around, facing Luna.
Didn't you already leave the Moon...? Or were you the one who created all this mess?
No way. A Punishing Virus contamination of unknown reason caused the zero-point reactor and that engine to go haywire, hence the mess in this base.
I see...

Luna tries to gather her strength and realizes she can attract the Punishing Virus that is spreading on the once-clean Moon. Still, the virus she can gather now is too weak and soon gets eliminated by the Omega Weapon.
I thought you were related to all this and came to finish you off before taking care of the rest... But that seems unnecessary now.
Karenina glances at Luna. The Omega Weapon has made her extremely frail.
Hmph, indeed... It's a matter of time before my body dies from the exhaustion of the Punishing Virus. You don't need to get your hands dirty.
Karenina walks back and forth, slightly hesitant. She opens her mouth in the end.

I have already reported the situation to Babylonia. They will send a shuttle here soon, but I need to destroy the zero-point engine before it arrives to minimize the damage caused by gravitational waves.

Even so, the overflowing zero-point energy could detonate all the built-up gravitational waves simultaneously... We may have the time to escape, but the loose rocks blown up by the gravitational waves would still hit the Earth and cause terrible disasters.
Karenina takes a deep breath and stares at Luna.

According to my calculations, if you can get the power of agent back again, the strength of the Punishing Virus you absorb should be on par with the Omega Weapon and therefore consume a lot of zero-point energy, reducing the final impact of gravitational waves.
Luna gives Karenina an unbelievable look as if she has just said something absurd.
Are you... trying to seek my assistance?
Yeah... Is there a problem? I'll do anything and use any resources available to achieve my goal, even if it means to seek help from the enemy.
Luna smiles. That commandant of her sister's was once doing the exact same thing—trying to borrow the enemy's strength like a fool.
Hey, you don't want to die like this, do you...? If that's the case...
But Luna shakes her head and interrupts Karenina.
I no longer have the ability to connect to the Ascension-Network or use the power of agent. Even if I can, I have no plan to help you just for the sake of living on.
To her, it may be better just to put an end to the agent named Luna once and for all. That way, both of her sisters can finally walk their own paths without worrying about her.
Besides, I don't think you should put your hope on Babylonia's rescue. They probably have already abandoned everybody here...
Compared with the lives of a few people on the Moon and the Earth, it would be a wiser choice for them to protect the zero-point engine, which is a symbol of future hope.
Luna once heard from that human named Yarha that Kurono wanted to install this engine and the zero-point reactor on Babylonia to restart the space travel project.

Zero-point reactor, Construct technology, Omega Weapon, new specialized frame... All those creations are carrying the hope of humans. They create the future for humans, but also become their shackles.
You'll become the enemy of humankind if you still choose to destroy the engine...
There is no taunt or anger in Luna's words. She is just stating the cold truth.
Do you really have the courage to pop their inflated hope?
